---
slug: /127
title: "This Week In React #127: Nextra, React-Query, React Documentary, Storybook, Remix, Tamagui, Solito, TC39, Rome..."
authors: [slorber]
date: 12-06-2022
---
Hi everyone!
We have some nice articles this week. I liked to discover how React-Query is implemented, or the latest Storybook news.

segments.source_content: [FlyCode](https://bit.ly/3wWSi00) (YC S22) makes React web apps editable in minutes so Product and UX teams can iterate and release products faster, so they don't have to wait on (or consume) developer time.

translations.fr: [FlyCode](https://bit.ly/3wWSi00) (YC S22) rend les applications web React modifiables en minutes pour que les √©quipes Produit et UX puissent it√©rer et publier plus vite, sans attendre (ou consommer) le temps des d√©veloppeurs.
translations.en: [FlyCode](https://bit.ly/3wWSi00) (YC S22) permet de rendre les applications web React modifiables en quelques minutes pour que les √©quipes Produit et UX puissent it√©rer et livrer plus vite, sans attendre (ou consommer) le temps des d√©veloppeurs.

segments.source_content: FlyCode reads your regular React code and finds Texts, Images, Design tokens and Analytics event, then it let's non-coders collaborate and edit them and send back a pull request (they don't need access to GitHub!)

translations.fr: FlyCode analyse votre code React standard, identifie Textes, Images, Tokens design et √âv√©nements analytiques, puis permet aux non-d√©veloppeurs de les modifier et d'envoyer une pull request (sans acc√®s GitHub !).
translations.en: FlyCode analyse votre code React standard, identifie les textes, images, tokens design et √©v√©nements analytiques, puis permet aux non-codeurs de collaborer, de les modifier et d'envoyer une pull request (sans acc√®s √† GitHub !).

segments.source_content:
- Saves development time
- No code integration, it just reads your code!
- GitHub based, a bot is scanning the code and creates pull requests
- Use your own stack and components
- Retain codebase ownership

translations.fr:
- √âconomise du temps de d√©veloppement
- Aucune int√©gration de code, il lit simplement votre code !
- Bas√© sur GitHub : un bot scanne le code et cr√©e des pull requests
- Utilisez votre propre stack et composants
- Conservez la propri√©t√© du codebase
translations.en:
- √âconomise du temps de d√©veloppement
- Int√©gration sans code, il lit simplement votre code !
- Bas√© sur GitHub, un bot scanne le code et cr√©e des pull requests
- Utilisez votre propre stack et composants
- Conservez la propri√©t√© du codebase

segments.source_content: You can get started here: [flycode.com/developers](https://www.flycode.com/developers)
## ‚öõÔ∏è React {#react}
**[Nextra 2.0](https://nextra.site/)**

Nextra is a tool to facilitate the creation of documentation sites, based on Next.js, and created by a Vercel engineer. v2 has just been released with a great redesign and a nice list of features (MDX 2, Tailwind, search, i18n, a11y, code highlighting...). Relying on Next.js allows to benefit from a modern infrastructure and the latest Next.js innovations, but also to create more dynamic pages (SSR, ISR) associated to static documentation pages. It is a very serious competitor to [Docusaurus](https://docusaurus.io/), the tool I am working on.

translations.fr: Nextra est un outil facilitant la cr√©ation de sites de documentation, bas√© sur Next.js et d√©velopp√© par un ing√©nieur de Vercel. La v2 vient de sortir avec une refonte majeure et des fonctionnalit√©s notables (MDX 2, Tailwind, recherche, i18n, a11y, surbrillance de code...). S'appuyer sur Next.js permet de b√©n√©ficier d'une infrastructure moderne, des derni√®res innovations Next.js, et de cr√©er des pages dynamiques (SSR, ISR) associ√©es √† de la documentation statique. C'est un concurrent s√©rieux pour [Docusaurus](https://docusaurus.io/), l'outil sur lequel je travaille.
translations.en: Nextra est un outil facilitant la cr√©ation de sites de documentation, bas√© sur Next.js et cr√©√© par un ing√©nieur de Vercel. La v2 vient de sortir avec une refonte majeure et de nombreuses fonctionnalit√©s (MDX 2, Tailwind, recherche, i18n, a11y, surlignage de code...). S'appuyer sur Next.js permet de b√©n√©ficier d'une infrastructure moderne et des derni√®res innovations Next.js, tout en cr√©ant des pages dynamiques (SSR, ISR) associ√©es √† de la documentation statique. C'est un concurrent tr√®s s√©rieux pour [Docusaurus](https://docusaurus.io/), l'outil sur lequel je travaille.

segments.source_content: [![Nextra 2.0](/emails/issues/127/nextra.jpg)](https://nextra.site/)
**[Inside React Query](https://tkdodo.eu/blog/inside-react-query)**

Dominik explains how React-Query works, and details the relationships between its different elements: QueryClient, QueryCache, Query, Persister, QueryObserver... Many of these elements do not depend on React, and this is what allows TanStack Query to easily support other frameworks like SolidJS thanks to adapters.

translations.fr: Dominik explique le fonctionnement de React-Query et d√©taille les relations entre ses composants : QueryClient, QueryCache, Query, Persister, QueryObserver... Beaucoup n'ont pas de d√©pendance √† React, ce qui permet √† TanStack Query de supporter facilement d'autres frameworks comme SolidJS via des adaptateurs.
translations.en: Dominik explique le fonctionnement de React-Query et d√©taille les relations entre ses diff√©rents √©l√©ments : QueryClient, QueryCache, Query, Persister, QueryObserver... Beaucoup de ces composants sont ind√©pendants de React, ce qui permet √† TanStack Query de supporter facilement d'autres frameworks comme SolidJS via des adaptateurs.

segments.source_content: [![Inside React Query](/emails/issues/127/react-query.png)](https://tkdodo.eu/blog/inside-react-query)
**[NextJS, SvelteKit, Remix and the future of Storybook](https://storybook.js.org/blog/framework-api/)**

Storybook 7.0 will have a new Framework API. It will allow the creation of "Framework packages" (example: `@storybook/nextjs`) that pre-configure your Storybook for a given stack (builder, renderer, app settings), and that you can extend. The support of several frameworks based on Vite is ready. Next.js and SvelteKit frameworks are coming soon, and a Remix support is considered.

translations.fr: Storybook 7.0 disposera d'une nouvelle API Framework. Elle permettra la cr√©ation de ¬´ packages Framework ¬ª (exemple : `@storybook/nextjs`) qui pr√©configureront votre Storybook pour une pile donn√©e (builder, renderer, param√®tres d'application), et que vous pourrez √©tendre. La prise en charge de plusieurs frameworks bas√©s sur Vite est pr√™te. Les frameworks Next.js et SvelteKit arrivent bient√¥t, et une prise en charge de Remix est envisag√©e.
translations.en: Storybook 7.0 disposera d'une nouvelle API de Framework. Elle permettra la cr√©ation de "packages Framework" (exemple : `@storybook/nextjs`) qui pr√©configurent votre Storybook pour une pile donn√©e (builder, renderer, param√®tres d'application), et que vous pouvez √©tendre. La prise en charge de plusieurs frameworks bas√©s sur Vite est pr√™te. Les frameworks Next.js et SvelteKit arrivent bient√¥t, et une prise en charge de Remix est envisag√©e.

segments.source_content: [![NextJS, SvelteKit, Remix and the future of Storybook](/emails/issues/127/storybook-frameworks.png)](https://storybook.js.org/blog/framework-api/)

translations.fr: [![NextJS, SvelteKit, Remix and the future of Storybook](/emails/issues/127/storybook-frameworks.png)](https://storybook.js.org/blog/framework-api/)

segments.source_content:
- üçø [React.js - The Documentary - Trailer](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gmp0istg5xo): a documentary about React should be released in February. In the meantime you can check this 2min trailer. A nice list of guests have participated. I'm really looking forward to seeing this, and remembering the early years of React. This [parody](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ov0alO_k_1k) also made me laugh ;)
- üìñ Beta docs: [useTransition](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1598468389340585984) + [Suspense](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1598412132827435008) + [useDeferredValue](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1598414645244534784). We can sympathize with Dan Abramov who [dreams of documentation at night](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1598149838017003520) üòÖ Glad this long effort is coming to an end.
- üìú [Lessons learned: how I‚Äôd rebuild a social web app like Twitter today](https://paularmstrong.dev/blog/2022/11/28/lessons-learned-how-i-would-rebuild-twitter-today/): Paul worked on the Twitter web app. He wonders what choices he would make for it today. He would use Tailwind instead of React-Native-Web, which presents some pragmatic difficulties, and Twitter doesn't use React-Native so the cross-platform benefits are limited. He would also use a more reactive framework like SolidJS or Preact + Signals. Many other interesting points: Vite, Module Federation, Client Hints, Deno...
- üìú [React vs React Native: How Different Are They, Really?](https://echobind.com/post/react-vs-react-native-how-different-are-they): details the many similarities and differences between React (DOM) and React-Native. A good resource for web developers who might be tempted to learn React-Native and want to know how much knowledge they will be able to reuse, but also for managers looking to understand what it takes to adopt React-Native.
- üìú [Different Dimensions of Remix Deploy Targets](https://andre-landgraf.dev/blog/2022-12-03_different-dimensions-of-remix-deploy-targets): Remix can be deployed on different platforms, thanks to its adapters. This article analyzes each target platform along several dimensions and helps us to make an informed choice.
- üìú [Component Testing in Storybook](https://bradfrost.com/blog/link/component-testing-in-storybook/): Brad Frost gives his positive opinion on the latest Storybook testing features presented in [this video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wEa6W8uUGSA). I also agree that Jest alone is not a suitable tool for visual rendering.
- üìú [React Conditional Rendering With Type Safety and Exhaustive Checking](https://www.lloydatkinson.net/posts/2022/react-conditional-rendering-with-type-safety-and-exhaustive-checking/): React + TypeScript tip useful to know to make sure not to forget any case of an union-type (waiting for a real pattern matching support).
- üìú [How we migrated from Redux to TanStack Query and Redux Toolkit](https://tech.storyly.io/how-we-migrated-from-redux-to-tanstack-query-and-redux-toolkit-ac9be2f445be): the story of 2 quite different projects based on Redux, and migrated incrementally to distinct solutions: RTK and React-Query.
- üìú [Why you should reconsider prefetching in Remix](https://www.themosaad.com/blog/reconsider-prefetching-in-remix): an interesting reflection on the impact of a very fast but inconsistent navigation (ie sometimes slower without prefetching). I have a mixed opinion on the conclusion: we should be able to keep prefetching and make the UX consistent.
- üìú [Add rolling sessions to Remix](https://sergiodxa.com/articles/add-rolling-sessions-to-remix)
- üìú [The Children Prop Pattern in React](https://www.craftvalue.io/blog/react-children-prop-pattern)
- üé• [TanStack Router: Type safe routing and URL state management for your applications](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qUZm3gbMOeo): Tanner presents his new 100% typesafe and agnostic router. I make the [same observation as him](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1555493419128168449): the existing APIs (Next.js, React-Router) do not facilitate the creation of apps that use query-strings a lot, and a new typesafe solution is welcome.
- üé• [React Streaming In Depth! NextJS! Remix! DIY!](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o3JWb04DRIs): long video that details how streaming works with React, via the Next.js and Remix frameworks. Also offers a home-made implementation (not for production).
- üé• [Remix - Roadmap Planning #1](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YSo0vKqAWtk): first public roadmapping session for the framework, as announced in [Open Development for Remix](https://remix.run/blog/open-development).
- üé• [ChatGPT refactoring php + jquery to Next.js](https://twitter.com/thekitze/status/1598414259137880066): this new AI is impressive and has devs talking a lot this week on Twitter!
- üé® [HTML + React-Three-Fiber demo](https://twitter.com/0xca0a/status/1599367266448994304): cela semble de plus en plus facile, et performant, d'int√©grer du HTML dans une scene 3D avec React-Three-Fiber.
- üê¶ [Nodejs.dev adopting Next.js?](https://twitter.com/ovflowd/status/1599417661242232832): the Node.js doc could migrate from Gatsby to Next.js
- üê¶ [React Server Components + MDX](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1598615824927002624): the impact of RSC is potentially important for content sites using MDX, like Docusaurus or Nextra ;)
- üì® [React.holiday](https://react.holiday/): ephemeral avent newsletter of 25 short emails about new features of Next.js 13
- üì¶ [Papanasi 1.0](https://twitter.com/CKGrafico/status/1597585206034169857): v1 release of this innovative UI components library. It is based on [Mitosis](https://github.com/builderio/mitosis), which allows to compile code to all frameworks at once: React, Vue, Svelte, Solid...
- üì¶ [Jotai 1.11](https://twitter.com/jotaijs/status/1598366077527810048)
- üì¶ [Gatsby 5.2](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/docs/reference/release-notes/v5.2/)
- üì¶ [Redwood 3.5](https://github.com/redwoodjs/redwood/releases/tag/v3.5.0)

## üì± React-Native {#react-native}

- üìä [State of React Native](https://stateofreactnative.com/): Software Mansion is preparing a survey around React-Native and invites us to contribute to the questions asked: [2022 Call for Questions](https://github.com/software-mansion/state-of-react-native/discussions/1).
- üì¶ [Tamagui v1 Release Candidate](https://tamagui.dev/blog/version-one-release-candidate): Tamagui is a promising solution based on a compiler to style its React components in a universal way (mobile and web). The move to RC marks the stabilization of the APIs.
- üì¶ [Solito v2](https://solito.dev/v2): cross-platform navigation solution. Next.js 13 support + SolitoImage component.
- üì¶ [Reanimated 3.0-rc.8](https://twitter.com/kzzzf/status/1598394289570156544): new and much more efficient implementation of Shared Values
- üì¶ [Preact-Native](https://github.com/barelyhuman/preact-native): a dev wants to run Preact with React-Native. This seems complex, and put on [stand-by](https://reaper.is/writing/20221204-decisions-and-updates-november-2022).
- üì¶ [create-react-native-library 0.27.2](https://twitter.com/satya164/status/1598774126805766144): supports RN 0.71, Fabric template...
- üì¶ [React-Native 0.71.0-RC.3](https://twitter.com/Kelset/status/1598018432229777408): 0.71 should come soon!
- üì¶ [Airbnb - Announcing Lottie 4.0 for iOS](https://medium.com/airbnb-engineering/announcing-lottie-4-0-for-ios-d4d226862a54)
- üì¶ [Maestro](https://github.com/mobile-dev-inc/maestro): end-2-end blackbox testing tool that is gaining popularity (comparable to Appium)
- üí¨ [Expo Router RFC - Shared Routes](https://twitter.com/Baconbrix/status/1598074538298048512)
- üí¨ [VisionCamera 3.0 discussion](https://github.com/mrousavy/react-native-vision-camera/issues/1376)
- üê¶ [Krzysztof Magiera - "Next version of reanimated will finally have proper stack trace support."](https://twitter.com/kzzzf/status/1598828117509910528)
- üé• [Confetti Animation with React-Native Skia](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qOhYFDOEOmo)

translations.fr:
- üìä [State of React Native](https://stateofreactnative.com/) : Software Mansion pr√©pare une enqu√™te autour de React Native et nous invite √† contribuer aux questions pos√©es : [2022 Call for Questions](https://github.com/software-mansion/state-of-react-native/discussions/1).
- üì¶ [Tamagui v1 Release Candidate](https://tamagui.dev/blog/version-one-release-candidate) : Tamagui est une solution prometteuse bas√©e sur un compilateur pour styliser ses composants React de mani√®re universelle (mobile et web). Le passage en RC marque la stabilisation des API.
- üì¶ [Solito v2](https://solito.dev/v2) : solution de navigation multiplateforme. Support de Next.js 13 + composant SolitoImage.
- üì¶ [Reanimated 3.0-rc.8](https://twitter.com/kzzzf/status/1598394289570156544) : nouvelle impl√©mentation des Shared Values bien plus efficace.
- üì¶ [Preact-Native](https://github.com/barelyhuman/preact-native) : un d√©veloppeur souhaite ex√©cuter Preact avec React Native. Cela semble complexe, et mis en [veille](https://reaper.is/writing/20221204-decisions-and-updates-november-2022).
- üì¶ [create-react-native-library 0.27.2](https://twitter.com/satya164/status/1598774126805766144) : supporte RN 0.71, template Fabric...
- üì¶ [React-Native 0.71.0-RC.3](https://twitter.com/Kelset/status/1598018432229777408) : la version 0.71 devrait arriver bient√¥t !
- üì¶ [Airbnb - Announcing Lottie 4.0 for iOS](https://medium.com/airbnb-engineering/announcing-lottie-4-0-for-ios-d4d226862a54)
- üì¶ [Maestro](https://github.com/mobile-dev-inc/maestro) : outil de test end-to-end en bo√Æte noire qui gagne en popularit√© (comparable √† Appium).
- üí¨ [Expo Router RFC - Shared Routes](https://twitter.com/Baconbrix/status/1598074538298048512)
- üí¨ [VisionCamera 3.0 discussion](https://github.com/mrousavy/react-native-vision-camera/issues/1376)
- üê¶ [Krzysztof Magiera - "La prochaine version de reanimated aura enfin un support appropri√© des stack traces."](https://twitter.com/kzzzf/status/1598828117509910528)
- üé• [Animation de confettis avec React-Native Skia](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qOhYFDOEOmo)
translations.en:
- üìä [State of React Native](https://stateofreactnative.com/): Software Mansion pr√©pare une enqu√™te autour de React-Native et nous invite √† contribuer aux questions pos√©es : [2022 Call for Questions](https://github.com/software-mansion/state-of-react-native/discussions/1).
- üì¶ [Tamagui v1 Release Candidate](https://tamagui.dev/blog/version-one-release-candidate): Tamagui est une solution prometteuse bas√©e sur un compilateur pour styliser ses composants React de mani√®re universelle (mobile et web). Le passage en RC marque la stabilisation des API.
- üì¶ [Solito v2](https://solito.dev/v2): solution de navigation multiplateforme. Prise en charge de Next.js 13 + composant SolitoImage.
- üì¶ [Reanimated 3.0-rc.8](https://twitter.com/kzzzf/status/1598394289570156544): nouvelle impl√©mentation des Shared Values, beaucoup plus efficace.

segments.source_content: ## üßë‚Äçüíª Jobs {#jobs}

üßë‚Äçüíº [**Product Engineer at Causal, Remote/London/NY, $150-250k**](https://jobs.lever.co/causal-app/4acaafbe-ef3d-45a6-bbe6-687c022d727c?lever-origin=applied&lever-source%5B%5D=thisweekinreact.com)

Causal is a Series A Startup (backed by Coatue/Accel) building an all-in-one tool for working with numbers and visualizing data. We're looking for strong React engineers who can solve difficult UX/performance challenges.

segments.source_content: Do you want to work on the world's most used apps? Would you like to co-create the React Native technology? Join the Callstack team of React & React Native leaders. Check our website for more details. We are looking forward to seeing your application - show us what you've got!

Rejoignez l'√©quipe Callstack de leaders React & React Native. Consultez notre site pour plus de d√©tails. Nous attendons votre candidature avec impatience - montrez-nous ce que vous savez faire !

## üîÄ Other {#other}
**[Updates from the 93rd TC39 meeting](https://dev.to/hemanth/updates-from-the-93rd-tc39-meeting-2n8f)**
Some very nice proposals for JavaScript have progressed last week, in particular:

translations.fr: Quelques tr√®s belles propositions pour JavaScript ont progress√© la semaine derni√®re, en particulier :
translations.en: Plusieurs excellentes propositions pour JavaScript ont progress√© la semaine derni√®re, notamment :

segments.source_content:
- [Set Methods](https://twitter.com/robpalmer2/status/1597947853598785537) in stage 3: union, intersection, difference... üôå
- [Iterator Helpers](https://github.com/tc39/proposal-iterator-helpers) in stage 3: map, flatMap, filter, reduce...
- Intl APIs that continue to complement each other.

translations.fr:
- [M√©thodes Set](https://twitter.com/robpalmer2/status/1597947853598785537) en phase 3 : union, intersection, diff√©rence... üôå
- [Aides aux it√©rateurs](https://github.com/tc39/proposal-iterator-helpers) en phase 3 : map, flatMap, filter, reduce...
- Les API Intl qui continuent de se compl√©ter.
translations.en:
- [Set Methods](https://twitter.com/robpalmer2/status/1597947853598785537) en stage 3 : union, intersection, diff√©rence... üôå
- [Iterator Helpers](https://github.com/tc39/proposal-iterator-helpers) en stage 3 : map, flatMap, filter, reduce...
- Les API Intl continuent de se compl√©ter mutuellement.
